flavorText: Normally found near power plants, it can wander away and cause major blackouts in cities.

name: Electrode

abilities.name: Buzzap
abilities.text: At any time during your turn (before your attack), you may Knock Out Electrode and attach it to 1 of your other Pokémon. If you do, choose a type of Energy. Electrode is now an Energy card of that type (instead of a Pokémon) that provides 2 energy. This power can't be used if Electrode is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Electric Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Electrode does 10 damage to itself.

flavorText: It stores electrical energy under very high pressure. It often explodes with little or no provocation.

name: Kangaskhan

attacks.name: Fetch
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Comet Punch
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: The infant rarely ventures out of its mother's protective pouch until it is three years old.

name: Mr. Mime

abilities.name: Invisible Wall
abilities.text: Whenever an attack (including your own) does 30 or more damage to Mr. Mime (after applying Weakness and Resistance), prevent that damage. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.) This power stops working while Mr. Mime is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Meditate
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

flavorText: If interrupted while miming, it will slap around the enemy with its broad hands.

name: Pidgeotto

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Mirror Move
attacks.text: If Pidgeotto was attacked last turn, do the final result of that attack on Pidgeotto to the Defending Pokémon.

flavorText: Very protective of its sprawling territory, this Pokémon will fiercely peck at any intruder.

name: Pinsir

attacks.name: Irongrip
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: If it fails to crush the victim in its pincers, it will swing its victim around and toss it hard.

name: Snorlax

abilities.name: Thick Skinned
abilities.text: Snorlax can't become Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned. This power can't be used if Snorlax is already Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: Very lazy. Just eats and sleeps. As its rotund bulk builds, it becomes steadily more slothful.

name: Venomoth

abilities.name: Shift
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may change the type of Venomoth to the type of any other Pokémon in play other than Colorless. This power can't be used if Venomoth is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Venom Powder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

flavorText: The dust-like scales covering its wings are color coded to indicate the kinds of poison it has.

name: Victreebel

attacks.name: Lure
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and switch it with his or her Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Acid
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your next turn.

flavorText: Said to live in huge colonies deep in jungles, although no one has ever returned from there.

name: Arcanine

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Arcanine in order to use this attack.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Arcanine does 30 damage to itself.

flavorText: A Pokémon that has been long admired for its beauty. It runs gracefully, as if on wings.

name: Butterfree

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Mega Drain
attacks.text: Remove a number of damage counters from Butterfree equal to half the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance) (rounded up to the nearest 10). If Butterfree has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

flavorText: In battle, it flaps its wings at high speed to release highly toxic dust into the air.

name: Charmeleon

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Charmeleon in order to use this attack.

flavorText: When it swings its burning tail, it raises the temperature to unbearably high levels.

name: Dewgong

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: Stores thermal energy in its body. Swims at a steady 8 knots even in intensely cold waters.

name: Dodrio

abilities.name: Retreat Aid
abilities.text: As long as Dodrio is Benched, pay Colorless less to retreat your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Dodrio.

flavorText: Uses its three brains to execute complex plans. While two heads sleep, one head stays awake.

name: Dratini
flavorText: Long considered a mythical Pokémon until recently, when a small colony was found living underwater.

name: Exeggutor

attacks.name: Teleport
attacks.text: Switch Exeggutor with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Big Eggsplosion
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Energy attached to Exeggutor. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: Legend has it that on rare occasions, one of its heads will drop off and continue on as an Exeggcute.

name: Farfetch'd

attacks.name: Leek Slap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. Either way, you can't use this attack again as long as Farfetch'd stays in play (even putting Farfetch'd on the Bench won't let you use it again).

flavorText: The sprig of green onions it holds is its weapon. This sprig is used much like a metal sword.

name: Fearow

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Fearow.

flavorText: With its huge and magnificent wings, it can keep aloft without ever having to land for rest.

name: Growlithe
flavorText: Very protective of its territory. It will bark and bite to repel intruders from its space.

name: Haunter

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Dream Eater
attacks.text: You can't use this attack unless the Defending Pokémon is Asleep.

flavorText: Because of its ability to slip through block walls, it is said to be from another dimension.

name: Ivysaur

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: When the bulb on its back grows large, the Pokémon seems to lose the ability to stand on its hind legs.

name: Jynx

attacks.name: Doubleslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Meditate
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

flavorText: Merely by meditating, the Pokémon launches a powerful psychic energy attack.

name: Kadabra

attacks.name: Recover
attacks.text: Discard 1 Psychic Energy card attached to Kadabra in order to use this attack. Remove all damage counters from Kadabra.

flavorText: It emits special alpha waves from its body that induce headaches even to those just nearby.

name: Kakuna

attacks.name: Stiffen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Kakuna during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: Almost incapable of moving, this Pokémon can only harden its shell to protect itself from predators.

name: Lickitung

attacks.name: Tongue Wrap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: Its tongue can be extended like a chameleon's. It leaves a stinging sensation when it licks enemies.

name: Machoke

attacks.name: Karate Chop
attacks.text: Does 50 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on Machoke.

attacks.name: Submission
attacks.text: Machoke does 20 damage to itself.

flavorText: Its muscular body is so powerful that it must wear a power-save belt to help regulate its motions.

name: Magikarp

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Magikarp.

flavorText: In the distant past, it was stronger than its horribly weak descendants that exist today.

name: Magmar

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Magmar in order to use this attack.

flavorText: Its body always burns with an orange glow that enables it to hide perfectly among flames.

name: Marowak

attacks.name: Bonemerang
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Call for Friend
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fighting Basic Pokémon card and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. (You can't use this attack if your Bench is full.)

flavorText: The bone it holds is its key weapon. It throws the bone skillfully like a boomerang to K.O. targets.

name: Nidorina

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: The female's horn develops slowly. Prefers physical attacks such as clawing and biting.

name: Nidorino

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: An aggressive Pokémon that is quick to attack. The horn on its head secretes a powerful venom.

name: Parasect

attacks.name: Spore
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

flavorText: A host-parasite pair in which the parasite mushroom has taken over the host bug. Prefers damp places.

name: Persian

attacks.name: Pounce
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon attacks Persian during your next turn, any damage done by the attack is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). (Benching either Pokémon ends this effect.)

flavorText: Although its fur has many admirers, it is tough to raise as a pet because of its fickle meanness.

name: Poliwhirl

attacks.name: Amnesia
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Doubleslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: Capable of living in or out of water. When out of water, it sweats to keep its body slimy.

name: Raticate

attacks.name: Super Fang
attacks.text: Does damage to the Defending Pokémon equal to half the Defending Pokémon's remaining HP (rounded up to the nearest 10).

flavorText: It uses its whiskers to maintain its balance. It seems to slow down if they are cut off.

name: Rhydon

attacks.name: Ram
attacks.text: Rhydon does 20 damage to itself. If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon. Switch the Pokémon even if Rhydon is knocked out.)

flavorText: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3600 degrees.

name: Seaking
flavorText: In the autumn spawning season, they can be seen swimming powerfully up rivers and creeks.

name: Seel
flavorText: The protruding horn on its head is very hard. This horn is used for bashing through thick ice.

name: Tauros

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 20 damage.

attacks.name: Rampage
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Tauros. Flip a coin. If tails, Tauros is now Confused (after doing damage).

flavorText: When it targets an enemy, it charges furiously while whipping its body with its long tails.

name: Wartortle

attacks.name: Withdraw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Wartortle during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

flavorText: Often hides in water to stalk unweary prey. When swimming quickly, it moves its ears to maintain balance.

name: Weepinbell

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: It spits out poisonpowder to immobilize the enemy, and then finishes the enemy with a spray of acid.

name: Abra

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: Using its ability to read minds, it will identify impending danger and teleport to safety.

name: Bellsprout

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon named Bellsprout and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. (You can't use this attack if your Bench is full.)

flavorText: A carnivorous Pokémon that traps and eats bugs. It uses its root feet to soak up needed moisture.

name: Bulbasaur

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Unless all damage from this attack is prevented, you may remove 1 damage counter from Bulbasaur.

flavorText: A strange seed was planted on its back at birth. Thus, a plant sprouted and now grows with this Pokémon.

name: Caterpie

attacks.name: String Shot
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.

name: Charmander

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Charmander in order to use this attack.

flavorText: Obviously prefers hot places. If it gets caught in the rain, steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.

name: Cubone

attacks.name: Snivel
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon attacks Cubone during your opponent's next turn, any damage done by the attack is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). (Benching either Pokémon ends this effect.)

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Cubone.

flavorText: Because it never removes its skull helmet, no one has ever seen this Pokémon's real face.

name: Diglett
flavorText: Lives about three feet underground, where it feeds on plant roots. It sometimes appears above ground.

name: Doduo

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: A bird that makes up for its poor flying with its fast foot speed. Leaves giant footprints.

name: Drowzee

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: Puts enemies to sleep, then eats their dreams. Occasionally gets sick from eating bad dreams.

name: Exeggcute

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Unless all damage from this attack is prevented, you may remove 1 damage counter from Exeggcute.

flavorText: Often mistaken for eggs. When disturbed, they quickly gather and attack in swarms.

name: Gastly

attacks.name: Sleeping Gas
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Destiny Bond
attacks.text: Discard 1 Psychic Energy card attached to Gastly in order to use this attack. If a Pokémon Knocks Out Gastly during your opponent's next turn, Knock Out that Pokémon.

flavorText: Almost invisible, this gaseous Pokémon cloaks the target and puts it to sleep without notice.

name: Goldeen
flavorText: Its tail fin billows like an elegant ballroom dress, giving it the nickname "Water Queen."

name: Jigglypuff

attacks.name: Lullaby
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

flavorText: When its huge eyes light up, it sings a mysteriously soothing melody that lulls its enemies to sleep.

name: Machop
flavorText: Loves to build its muscles. It trains in all styles of martial arts to become even stronger.

name: Magnemite

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Pokémon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Magnemite does 40 damage to itself.

flavorText: Uses anti-gravity to stay suspended. Appears without warning and uses attacks like Thunder Wave.

name: Meowth

attacks.name: Pay Day
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, draw a card.

flavorText: Adores circular objects. Wanders the streets on a nightly basis to look for dropped loose change.

name: Metapod

attacks.name: Stiffen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Metapod during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: It is vulnerable to attack because its shell is soft, exposing its weak and tender body.

name: Nidoran ♀

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon named Nidoran ♂ or Nidoran ♀ and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. (You can't use this attack if your Bench is full.)

flavorText: Although small, its venomous barbs make this Pokémon dangerous. The female has smaller horns.

name: Nidoran ♂

attacks.name: Horn Hazard
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: Stiffens its ears to sense danger. The larger, more powerful of its horns secretes venom.

name: Onix

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, whenever 30 or less damage is done to Onix (after applying Weakness and Resistance), prevent that damage. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

flavorText: As it grows, the stone portions of its body harden to become similar to a diamond, though colored black.

name: Paras

attacks.name: Spore
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

flavorText: Burrows to suck tree roots. The mushrooms on its back grow by drawing nutrients from the bug host.

name: Pidgey

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

flavorText: A common sight in forests and woods. It flaps its wings at ground level to kick up blinding sand.

name: Pikachu

attacks.name: Thunder Jolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Pikachu does 10 damage to itself.

flavorText: When several of these Pokémon gather, their electricity can cause lightning storms.

name: Poliwag

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Poliwag but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

flavorText: Its newly grown legs prevent it from running. It appears to prefer swimming over trying to stand.

name: Rattata
flavorText: Bites anything when it attacks. Small and very quick, it is a common sight in many places.

name: Rhyhorn

attacks.name: Leer
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack Rhyhorn during your opponent's next turn. (Benching either Pokémon ends this effect.)

flavorText: Its massive bones are 1,000 times harder than human bones. It can easily knock a trailer flying.

name: Sandshrew

attacks.name: Sand-attack
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

flavorText: Burrows deep underground in arid locations far from water. It only emerges to hunt for food.

name: Spearow

attacks.name: Mirror Move
attacks.text: If Spearow was attacked last turn, do the final result of that attack on Spearow to the Defending Pokémon.

flavorText: Eats bugs in grassy areas. It has to flap its short wings at high speeds to stay airborne.

name: Squirtle

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Withdraw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Squirtle during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of opponent's attacks still happen.)

flavorText: After birth, its back swells and hardens into a shell. It powerfully sprays foam from its mouth.

name: Starmie

attacks.name: Recover
attacks.text: Discard 1 Water Energy card attached to Starmie in order to use this attack. Remove all damage counters from Starmie.

attacks.name: Star Freeze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: Its central core glows with the seven colors of the rainbow. Some people value this core as a gem.

name: Staryu
flavorText: An enigmatic Pokémon that can effortlessly regenerate any appendage it loses in battle.

name: Tangela

attacks.name: Bind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: Its whole body is swathed with wide vines that are similar to seaweed. These vines shake as it walks.

name: Venonat

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Leech Life
attacks.text: Remove a number of damage counters from Venonat equal to the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance). If Venonat has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

flavorText: Lives in the shadows of tall trees where it eats insects. It is attracted by light at night.

name: Voltorb
flavorText: Usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a Poké Ball, it has zapped many people.

name: Vulpix

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: At the time of birth, it has just one tail. Its tail splits from the tip as it grows older.

name: Weedle

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: Often found in forests, eating leaves. It has a sharp, venomous stinger on its head.

name: Computer Search
rules: Discard 2 of the other cards from your hand in order to search your deck for any card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Imposter Professor Oak
rules: Your opponent shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck, then draws 7 cards.

name: Item Finder
rules: Discard 2 of the other cards from your hand in order to put a Trainer card from your discard pile into your hand.

name: Lass
rules: You and your opponent show each other your hands, then shuffle all the Trainer cards from your hands into your decks.

name: Pokémon Breeder
rules: Put a Stage 2 Evolution card from your hand on the matching Basic Pokémon. You can only play this card when you would be allowed to evolve that Pokémon anyway.

name: Pokémon Trader
rules: Trade 1 of the Basic Pokémon or Evolution cards in your hand for 1 of the Basic Pokémon or Evolution cards from your deck. Show both cards to your opponent. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Scoop Up
rules: Choose 1 of your Pokémon in play and return its Basic Pokémon card to your hand. (Discard all cards attached to that card.)

name: Super Energy Removal
rules: Discard 1 Energy card attached to 1 of your own Pokémon in order to choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and up to 2 Energy cards attached to it. Discard those Energy cards.

name: Defender
rules: Attach Defender to 1 of your Pokémon. At the end of your opponent's next turn, discard Defender. Damage done to that Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Energy Retrieval
rules: Trade 1 of the other cards in your hand for up to 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile.

name: Full Heal
rules: Your Active Pokémon is no longer Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned.

name: Maintenance
rules: Shuffle 2 of the other cards from your hand into your deck in order to draw a card.

name: PlusPower
rules: Attach PlusPower to your Active Pokémon. At the end of your turn, discard PlusPower. If this Pokémon's attack does damage to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), the attack does 10 more damage to the Defending Pokémon.

name: Pokémon Center
rules: Remove all damage counters from all of your own Pokémon with damage counters on them, then discard all Energy cards attached to those Pokémon.

name: Pokédex
rules: Look at up to 5 cards from the top of your deck and rearrange them as you like.

name: Professor Oak
rules: Discard your hand, then draw 7 cards.

name: Super Potion
rules: Discard 1 Energy card attached to 1 of your own Pokémon in order to remove up to 4 damage counters from that Pokémon.

name: Bill
rules: Draw 2 cards.

name: Energy Removal
rules: Choose 1 Energy card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and discard it.

name: Gust of Wind
rules: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with his or her Active Pokémon.

name: Poké Ball
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, you may search your deck for any Basic Pokémon or Evolution card. Show that card to your opponent, then put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Potion
rules: Remove up to 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon.

name: Switch
rules: Switch 1 of your Benched Pokémon with your Active Pokémon.

name: Double Colorless Energy
rules: Provides Colorless Colorless energy. Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.

name: Dark Alakazam

attacks.name: Teleport Blast
attacks.text: You may switch Dark Alakazam with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Mind Shock
attacks.text: Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

flavorText: Almost as if it were being controlled by something else, it never changes expressions, even in the middle of battle.

name: Dark Arbok

attacks.name: Stare
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.) If that Pokémon has a Pokémon Power, that power stops working until the end of your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Poison Vapor
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: Freezes its prey with its stare. If you should encounter one, remember not to look into its eyes.

name: Dark Blastoise

attacks.name: Hydrocannon
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Dark Blastoise but not used to pay for this attack. You can't add more than 40 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Rocket Tackle
attacks.text: Dark Blastoise does 10 damage to itself. Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Dark Blastoise during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

flavorText: An aggressive Pokémon that tackles anything it sees.

name: Dark Charizard

attacks.name: Continuous Fireball
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Fire Energy cards attached to Dark Charizard. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads. Discard a number of Fire Energy cards attached to Dark Charizard equal to the number of heads.

flavorText: Seemingly possessed, it spews fire like a volcano, trying to burn all it sees.

name: Dark Dragonite

abilities.name: Summon Minions
abilities.text: When you play Dark Dragonite from your hand, search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Giant Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: Sometimes called "The God of Destruction." Its wings are able to support it in spite of its massive weight.

name: Dark Dugtrio

abilities.name: Sinkhole
abilities.text: Whenever your opponent's Active Pokémon retreats, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, this power does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.) This power stops working while Dark Dugtrio is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Knock Down
attacks.text: Your opponent flips a coin. If tails, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage; if heads, this attack does 20 damage.

flavorText: Digs large sinkholes in the ground and tries to trap its enemies in them.

name: Dark Golbat

abilities.name: Sneak Attack
abilities.text: When you play Dark Golbat from your hand, you may choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. If you do, Dark Golbat does 10 damage to that Pokémon. Apply Weakness and Resistance.

attacks.name: Flitter
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

flavorText: Sneaks up silently on its prey and attacks it from behind, sometimes killing it with one bite.

name: Dark Gyarados

abilities.name: Final Beam
abilities.text: When Dark Gyarados is Knocked Out by an attack, flip a coin. If heads, this power does 20 damage for each Water Energy attached to Dark Gyarados to the Pokémon that Knocked Out Dark Gyarados. Apply Weakness and Resistance. This power doesn't work if Dark Gyarados is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: Normally found only in the deep ocean, it has recently been seen in shallow waters as well.

name: Dark Hypno

attacks.name: Bench Manipulation
attacks.text: Your opponent flips a number of coins equal to the number of Pokémon on his or her Bench. This attack does 20 damage times the number of tails. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

flavorText: Carries a pendulum with it always. Sometimes appears near less-traveled roads and schools at dusk.

name: Dark Machamp

attacks.name: Fling
attacks.text: Your opponent shuffles his or her Active Pokémon and all cards attached to it into his or her deck. This attack can't be used if your opponent has no Benched Pokémon.

flavorText: It is almost impossible to defend against a Machamp's four powerful arms.

name: Dark Magneton

attacks.name: Sonicboom
attacks.text: Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

attacks.name: Magnetic Lines
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any basic Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 of them. If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and attach that Energy card to it.

flavorText: The number of incidents of hackers using Magnetons to damage computer systems is steadily increasing.

name: Dark Slowbro

abilities.name: Reel In
abilities.text: When you play Dark Slowbro from your hand, choose up to 3 Basic Pokémon and/or Evolution cards from your discard pile and put them into your hand.

attacks.name: Fickle Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: It loves nothing better than to be left alone, and so sometimes ends up being manipulated by unscrupulous people.

name: Dark Vileplume

abilities.name: Hay Fever
abilities.text: No Trainer cards can be played. This power stops working while Dark Vileplume is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Petal Whirlwind
attacks.text: Flip a coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads. If you get 2 or more heads, Dark Vileplume is now Confused (after doing damage).

flavorText: Perhaps because of their strong-smelling pollen, other Pokémon do not approach areas where Vileplumes live.

name: Dark Weezing

attacks.name: Mass Explosion
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the total number of Koffings, Weezings, and Dark Weezings in play (Apply Weakness and Resistance.). Then, this attack does 20 damage to each Koffing, Weezing, and Dark Weezing (even your own). Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

attacks.name: Stun Gas
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned; if tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: Researchers have observed these Pokémon reproducing in industrial waste sites.

name: Here Comes Team Rocket!
rules: Each player plays with his or her Prize cards face up for the rest of the game.

name: Rocket's Sneak Attack
rules: Look at your opponent's hand. If he or she has any Trainer cards, choose 1 of them. Your opponent shuffles that card into his or her deck.

name: Rainbow Energy
rules: Attach Rainbow Energy to 1 of your Pokémon. While in play, Rainbow Energy counts as every type of basic Energy but only provides 1 Energy at a time. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card when not in play.) When you attach this card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon, it does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.)

name: Dark Alakazam

attacks.name: Teleport Blast
attacks.text: You may switch Dark Alakazam with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Mind Shock
attacks.text: Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

flavorText: Almost as if it were being controlled by something else, it never changes expressions, even in the middle of battle.

name: Dark Arbok

attacks.name: Stare
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.) If that Pokémon has a Pokémon Power, that power stops working until the end of your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Poison Vapor
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: Freezes its prey with its stare. If you should encounter one, remember not to look into its eyes.

name: Dark Blastoise

attacks.name: Hydrocannon
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Dark Blastoise but not used to pay for this attack. You can't add more than 40 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Rocket Tackle
attacks.text: Dark Blastoise does 10 damage to itself. Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Dark Blastoise during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

flavorText: An aggressive Pokémon that tackles anything it sees.

name: Dark Charizard

attacks.name: Continuous Fireball
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Fire Energy cards attached to Dark Charizard. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads. Discard a number of Fire Energy cards attached to Dark Charizard equal to the number of heads.

flavorText: Seemingly possessed, it spews fire like a volcano, trying to burn all it sees.

name: Dark Dragonite

abilities.name: Summon Minions
abilities.text: When you play Dark Dragonite from your hand, search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Giant Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: Sometimes called "The God of Destruction." Its wings are able to support it in spite of its massive weight.

name: Dark Dugtrio

abilities.name: Sinkhole
abilities.text: Whenever your opponent's Active Pokémon retreats, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, this power does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.) This power stops working while Dark Dugtrio is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Knock Down
attacks.text: Your opponent flips a coin. If tails, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage; if heads, this attack does 20 damage.

flavorText: Digs large sinkholes in the ground and tries to trap its enemies in them.

name: Dark Golbat

abilities.name: Sneak Attack
abilities.text: When you play Dark Golbat from your hand, you may choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. If you do, Dark Golbat does 10 damage to that Pokémon. Apply Weakness and Resistance.

attacks.name: Flitter
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

flavorText: Sneaks up silently on its prey and attacks it from behind, sometimes killing it with one bite.

name: Dark Gyarados

abilities.name: Final Beam
abilities.text: When Dark Gyarados is Knocked Out by an attack, flip a coin. If heads, this power does 20 damage for each Water Energy attached to Dark Gyarados to the Pokémon that Knocked Out Dark Gyarados. Apply Weakness and Resistance. This power doesn't work if Dark Gyarados is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: Normally found only in the deep ocean, it has recently been seen in shallow waters as well.

name: Dark Hypno

attacks.name: Bench Manipulation
attacks.text: Your opponent flips a number of coins equal to the number of Pokémon on his or her Bench. This attack does 20 damage times the number of tails. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

flavorText: Carries a pendulum with it always. Sometimes appears near less-traveled roads and schools at dusk.

name: Dark Machamp

attacks.name: Fling
attacks.text: Your opponent shuffles his or her Active Pokémon and all cards attached to it into his or her deck. This attack can't be used if your opponent has no Benched Pokémon.

flavorText: It is almost impossible to defend against a Machamp's four powerful arms.

name: Dark Magneton

attacks.name: Sonicboom
attacks.text: Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

attacks.name: Magnetic Lines
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any basic Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 of them. If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and attach that Energy card to it.

flavorText: The number of incidents of hackers using Magnetons to damage computer systems is steadily increasing.

name: Dark Slowbro

abilities.name: Reel In
abilities.text: When you play Dark Slowbro from your hand, choose up to 3 Basic Pokémon and/or Evolution cards from your discard pile and put them into your hand.

attacks.name: Fickle Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: It loves nothing better than to be left alone, and so sometimes ends up being manipulated by unscrupulous people.

name: Dark Vileplume

abilities.name: Hay Fever
abilities.text: No Trainer cards can be played. This power stops working while Dark Vileplume is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Petal Whirlwind
attacks.text: Flip a coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads. If you get 2 or more heads, Dark Vileplume is now Confused (after doing damage).

flavorText: Perhaps because of their strong-smelling pollen, other Pokémon do not approach areas where Vileplumes live.

name: Dark Weezing

attacks.name: Mass Explosion
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the total number of Koffings, Weezings, and Dark Weezings in play (Apply Weakness and Resistance.). Then, this attack does 20 damage to each Koffing, Weezing, and Dark Weezing (even your own). Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

attacks.name: Stun Gas
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned; if tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: Researchers have observed these Pokémon reproducing in industrial waste sites.

name: Dark Charmeleon

attacks.name: Fireball
attacks.text: Use this attack only if there are any Fire Energy cards attached to Dark Charmeleon. Flip a coin. If heads, discard 1 of those Energy cards. If tails, this attack does nothing (not even damage).

flavorText: Its tail is incredibly strong, able to lift up to 5 adult men.

name: Dark Dragonair

abilities.name: Evolutionary Light
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for an Evolution card. Show it to your opponent and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Dark Dragonair is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Tail Strike
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 20 damage.

flavorText: As is fitting for a legendary Pokémon, it has many strange powers, including the ability to make rain or snow fall.

name: Dark Electrode

attacks.name: Energy Bomb
attacks.text: Take all Energy cards attached to Dark Electrode and attach them to your Benched Pokémon (in any way you choose). If you have no Benched Pokémon, discard all Energy cards attached to Dark Electrode.

flavorText: Some researchers hypothesize that Electrode may actually be a form of energy instead of having an actual body.

name: Dark Flareon

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Dark Flareon.

attacks.name: Playing with Fire
attacks.text: Use this attack only if there are any Fire Energy cards attached to Dark Flareon. Flip a coin. If heads, discard 1 of those Energy cards and this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 30 damage.

flavorText: A Pokémon with a hot temper that can't be controlled once it's angered. Capable of breathing flames hotter than 3000°.

name: Dark Gloom

abilities.name: Pollen Stench
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused; if tails, your Active Pokémon is now Confused. This power can't be used if Dark Gloom is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: Its pollen has such a strong smell that it even confuses itself at times.

name: Dark Golduck

attacks.name: Third Eye
attacks.text: Discard 1 Energy card attached to Dark Golduck in order to draw up to 3 cards.

flavorText: When Psyducks evolve, their headaches disappear and they find themselves in possession of formidable mental powers.

name: Dark Jolteon

attacks.name: Lightning Flash
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Thunder Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, Dark Jolteon does 10 damage to itself.

flavorText: A dangerous Pokémon when angered. It likes to playfully shock people with the electricity it stores within its body.

name: Dark Kadabra

abilities.name: Matter Exchange
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a card from your hand in order to draw a card. This power can't be used if Dark Kadabra is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Mind Shock
attacks.text: Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

flavorText: Some people say that Kadabras are responsible for many of the mysterious events reported in the news.

name: Dark Machoke

attacks.name: Drag Off
attacks.text: Before doing damage, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with the Defending Pokémon. Do the damage to the new Defending Pokémon. This attack can't be used if your opponent has no Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Knock Back
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

flavorText: While normally peaceful and friendly, the number of incidents involving cruel Machokes is rising.

name: Dark Muk

abilities.name: Sticky Goo
abilities.text: As long as Dark Muk is your Active Pokémon, your opponent pays ColorlessColorless more to retreat his or her Active Pokémon. This power stops working while Dark Muk is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Sludge Punch
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: Muks appear suddenly, spreading sludge everywhere. Whenever one appears in a city, panic ensues.

name: Dark Persian

attacks.name: Fascinate
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with the Defending Pokémon. This attack can't be used if your opponent has no Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Poison Claws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: Popular with women because of its beautiful fur. The leader of the Rockets keeps one as a pet.

name: Dark Primeape

abilities.name: Frenzy
abilities.text: If Dark Primeape does any damage while it's Confused (even to itself), it does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Frenzied Attack
attacks.text: Dark Primeape is now Confused (after doing damage).

flavorText: Although Primeapes have always been mean, lately they seem to be becoming even more vicious and frenzied.

name: Dark Rapidash

attacks.name: Flame Pillar
attacks.text: You may discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Dark Rapidash when you use this attack. If you do and if your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: A wild, uncontrollable Pokémon. When running, it looks like a comet streaking through the sky.

name: Dark Vaporeon

attacks.name: Whirlpool
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 of them and discard it.

flavorText: A Pokémon capable of controlling water, so it is capable of creating giant whirlpools.

name: Dark Wartortle

attacks.name: Doubleslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Mirror Shell
attacks.text: If an attack does damage to Dark Wartortle during your opponent's next turn (even if Dark Wartortle is Knocked Out), Dark Wartortle attacks the Defending Pokémon for an equal amount of damage.

flavorText: A Pokémon with a negative attitude, it hides in its shell whenever it's in a bad mood—which is often.

name: Magikarp

attacks.name: Rapid Evolution
attacks.text: Search your deck for an Evolution card named Gyarados or Dark Gyarados and put it on Magikarp. (This counts as evolving Magikarp.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

flavorText: Recent research has revealed the presence of dragon DNA in this species of Pokémon.

name: Porygon

attacks.name: Conversion 1
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has a Weakness, you may change it to a type of your choice other than Colorless.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: More and more people play the slots every day, trying to win a Porygon.

name: Abra

attacks.name: Vanish
attacks.text: Shuffle Abra into your deck. (Discard all cards attached to Abra.)

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: It teleports itself away from danger, making it difficult to capture.

name: Charmander

abilities.name: Gather Fire
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may take 1 Fire Energy card attached to 1 of your other Pokémon and attach it to Charmander. This power can't be used if Charmander is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

flavorText: Many people find it cute and try to hold it, only to be burned by its tail.

name: Dark Raticate

attacks.name: Hyper Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: A Raticate's front teeth are incredibly powerful; it can destroy a two-story house with them in 5 minutes.

name: Diglett

attacks.name: Dig Under
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

flavorText: It follows Onixes in their tunnels, looking for scraps of food they have left behind.

name: Dratini

attacks.name: Wrap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: The capture of the first Dratini inspired the search for other legendary Pokémon.

name: Drowzee

abilities.name: Long-Distance Hypnosis
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep; if tails, your Active Pokémon is now Asleep. This power can't be used if Drowzee is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Nightmare
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

flavorText: Not popular with girls because of its attitude. Can often be heard muttering to itself in a low voice.

name: Eevee

attacks.name: Sand-attack
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

flavorText: A rare and unique Pokémon about which little is known, as few have been captured.

name: Ekans

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: A carnivore that swallows its prey whole. Pidgeys and Spearows are its favorite food.

name: Grimer

attacks.name: Poison Gas
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Sticky Hands
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

flavorText: It has recently been found that Grimers are formed in waste-processing plants, and can move into towns via sewers.

name: Koffing

attacks.name: Poison Gas
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: First discovered in a weapons factory, this Pokémon can now be found almost anywhere.

name: Machop
flavorText: It's said that not even pro wrestlers can take down a Machop.

name: Magnemite

attacks.name: Magnetism
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Magnemite, Magneton, and Dark Magneton on your Bench.

flavorText: It is said that enough Magnemites and Magnetons gather in one place, they can create a powerful magnetic barrier.

name: Mankey

attacks.name: Mischief
attacks.text: Shuffle your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Anger
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 20 damage.

flavorText: Normally friendly, it quickly becomes angry if it doesn't get what it wants.

name: Meowth

attacks.name: Coin Hurl
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

flavorText: A popular Pokémon that earns money for its owner with its "Pay Day" ability.

name: Oddish

attacks.name: Sleep Powder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: It wanders around at night sowing its seeds to create more Oddishes.

name: Ponyta

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Ponyta in order to use this attack.

flavorText: A gentle grass-eater, it will allow riders on its back. However, anyone attempting to do so must be careful not to get burned.

name: Psyduck

attacks.name: Dizziness
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Psyduck but not used to pay for this attack. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

flavorText: It is often seen holding its head in its paws, as if it were suffering from a headache.

name: Rattata

abilities.name: Trickery
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may switch 1 of your Prizes with the top card of your deck. This power can't be used if Rattata is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

flavorText: Loves to eat walnuts, chestnuts, cheese, and milk.

name: Slowpoke

attacks.name: Afternoon Nap
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Psychic Energy card and attach it to Slowpoke. Shuffle your deck afterward.

flavorText: Although it knows how to fish, no other intelligent behavior has been detected in it.

name: Squirtle
flavorText: Cute Pokémon that charms people with its innocent eyes. Loves swimming all day long.

name: Voltorb
flavorText: Usually seen only in power plants, it is sometimes seen in towns, apparently using the power lines to travel.

name: Zubat
flavorText: Lives in dark caves. Can occasionally be seen at night, when it flies in search of food.

name: Here Comes Team Rocket!
rules: Each player plays with his or her Prize cards face up for the rest of the game.

name: Rocket's Sneak Attack
rules: Look at your opponent's hand. If he or she has any Trainer cards, choose 1 of them. Your opponent shuffles that card into his or her deck.

name: The Boss's Way
rules: Search your deck for an Evolution card with Dark in its name. Show it to your opponent and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Challenge!
rules: Ask your opponent if he or she accepts your challenge. If your opponent declines (or if both Benches are full), draw 2 cards. If your opponent accepts, each of you searches your decks for any number of Basic Pokémon cards and puts them face down onto your Benches. (A player can't do this if his or her Bench is full.) When you both have finished, shuffle your decks and turn those cards face up.

name: Digger
rules: Flip a coin. If tails, do 10 damage to your Active Pokémon. If heads, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, your opponent does 10 damage to his or her Active Pokémon. If heads, you flip a coin. Keep doing this until a player gets tails.

name: Imposter Oak's Revenge
rules: Discard a card from your hand in order to play this card. Your opponent shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck, then draws 4 cards.

name: Nightly Garbage Run
rules: Choose up to 3 Basic Pokémon cards, Evolution cards, and/or basic Energy cards from your discard pile. Show them to your opponent and shuffle them into your deck.

name: Goop Gas Attack
rules: All Pokémon Powers stop working until the end of your opponent's next turn.

name: Sleep!
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Rainbow Energy
rules: Attach Rainbow Energy to 1 of your Pokémon. While in play, Rainbow Energy counts as every type of basic Energy but only provides 1 Energy at a time. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card when not in play.) When you attach this card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon, it does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.)

name: Full Heal Energy
rules: If you play this card from your hand, the Pokémon you attach it to is no longer Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned.
Full Heal Energy provides Colorless energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

name: Potion Energy
rules: If you play this card from your hand, remove 1 damage counter from the Pokémon you attach it to, if it has any.
Potion Energy provides Colorless energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

name: Dark Raichu

attacks.name: Surprise Thunder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, flip another coin. If the second coin is heads, this attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If the second coin is tails, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: Stores up electricity in its body, then suddenly releases it to surprise and shock everyone.

name: Alakazam

abilities.name: Damage Swap
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon to another as long as you don't Knock Out that Pokémon. This power can't be used if Alakazam is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: Its brain can outperform a supercomputer. Its intelligence quotient is said to be 5000.

name: Articuno

attacks.name: Freeze Dry
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If tails, this attack does 10 damage to each of your own Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: A legendary bird Pokémon that is said to appear to doomed people who are lost in icy mountains.

name: Charizard

abilities.name: Energy Burn
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may turn all Energy attached to Charizard into Fire Energy for the rest of the turn. This power can't be used if Charizard is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy cards attached to Charizard or this attack does nothing.

flavorText: Spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. Known to unintentionally cause forest fires.

name: Dark Blastoise

attacks.name: Hydrocannon
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Dark Blastoise but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 40 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Rocket Tackle
attacks.text: Dark Blastoise does 10 damage to itself. Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Dark Blastoise during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

flavorText: An aggressive Pokémon that tackles anything it sees.

name: Dark Dragonite

abilities.name: Summon Minions
abilities.text: When you play Dark Dragonite from your hand, search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Giant Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: Sometimes called "The God of Destruction." Its wings are able to support it in spite of its massive weight.

name: Dark Persian

attacks.name: Fascinate
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with the Defending Pokémon. This attack can't be used if your opponent has no Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Poison Claws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: Popular with women because of its beautiful fur. The leader of the Rockets keeps one as a pet.

name: Dark Raichu

attacks.name: Surprise Thunder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, flip another coin. If the second coins is heads, this attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If the second coin is tails, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: Stores up electricity in its body, then suddenly releases it to surprise and shock everyone.

name: Dark Slowbro

abilities.name: Reel In
abilities.text: When you play Dark Slowbro from your hand, choose up to 3 Basic Pokémon and/or Evolution cards from your discard pile and put them into your hand.

attacks.name: Fickle Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: It loves nothing better than to be left alone, and so sometimes ends up being manipulated by unscrupulous people.

name: Dark Vaporeon

attacks.name: Whirlpool
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 of them and discard it.

flavorText: A Pokémon capable of controlling water, so it is capable of creating giant whirlpools.

name: Flareon

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Flareon or this attack does nothing.

flavorText: When storing thermal energy in its body, its temperature could soar to over 1600 degrees.

name: Gengar

abilities.name: Curse
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon to another (even if it would Knock Out the other Pokémon). This power can't be used if Gengar is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Dark Mind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: Under a full moon, this Pokémon like to mimic the shadows of people and laugh at their fright.

name: Gyarados

attacks.name: Bubblebeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: Rarely seen in the wild. Huge and vicious, it is capable of destroying entire cities in a rage.

name: Hitmonlee

attacks.name: Stretch Kick
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon, and this attack does 20 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: When in a hurry, its legs lengthen progressively. It runs smoothly with extra long, loping strides.

name: Jolteon

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Pin Missle
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: It accumulates negative ions from the atmosphere to blast out 10,000-volt lightning bolts.

name: Machamp

abilities.name: Strikes Back
abilities.text: Whenever your opponent's attack damages Machamp (even if Machamp is Knocked Out), this power does 10 damage to the attacking Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.) This power can't be used if Machamp is already affected by a Special Condition when your opponent attacks.

flavorText: Using its amazing muscles, it throws powerful punches that can knock its victim clear over the horizon.

name: Muk

abilities.name: Toxic Gas
abilities.text: Ignore all Pokémon Powers other than Toxic Gases. This power stops working while Muk is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Sludge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: Thickly covered with a filthy, vile sludge. It is so toxic, even its footprints contain poison.

name: Ninetales

attacks.name: Lure
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and switch it with the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fire Blast
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Ninetales or this attack does nothing.

flavorText: Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of its many tails could result in a 1,000-year curse.

name: Venusaur

abilities.name: Energy Trans
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may take 1 Grass Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon and attach it to a different one. This power can't be used if Venusaur is affected by a Special Condition.

flavorText: This plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.

name: Zapdos

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Zapdos does 30 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy cards attached to Zapdos or this attack does nothing.

flavorText: A legendary bird Pokémon said to appear from clouds while wielding enormous lightning bolts.

name: Beedrill

attacks.name: Twineedle
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: Flies at high speed and attacks using the large, venomous stingers on its forelegs and tail.

name: Butterfree

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Mega Drain
attacks.text: Remove a number of damage counters from Butterfree equal of half the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance) (rounded up to the nearest 10). If Butterfree has fewer damage counters that that, remove all of them.

flavorText: In battle, it flaps its wings at high speed to release highly toxic dust into the air.

name: Electrode

attacks.name: Chain Lightning
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon isn't Colorless, this attack does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon of the same type as the Defending Pokémon (including your own). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: It stores electrical energy under very high pressure. It often explodes with little or no provocation.

name: Exeggutor

attacks.name: Teleport
attacks.text: Switch Exeggutor with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Big Eggsplosion
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Energy attached to Exeggutor. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: Legend has it that on rare occasions, one of its heads will drop off and continue on as an Exeggcute.

name: Golem

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Pokémon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Golem does 100 damage to itself.

flavorText: Its boulder-like body is extremely hard. It can easily withstand dynamite blasts without damage.

name: Hypno

attacks.name: Prophecy
attacks.text: Look at up to 3 cards from the top of either player's deck and rearrange them as you like.

attacks.name: Dark Mind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: When it locks eyes with an enemy, it will use a mix of psi moves such as Hypnosis and Confusion.

name: Jynx

attacks.name: Doubleslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Meditate
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

flavorText: Merely by meditating, the Pokémon launches a powerful psychic energy attack.

name: Kabutops

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Remove a number of damage counters from Kabutops equal to half the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance) (rounded up to the nearest 10). If Kabutops has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

flavorText: Its sleek shape is perfect for swimming. It slashes prey with its claws and drains the body fluids.

name: Magneton

attacks.name: Sonicboom
attacks.text: Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Pokémon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Magneton does 100 damage to itself.

flavorText: Formed by several Magnemites linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.

name: Mewtwo

attacks.name: Energy Control
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a basic Energy card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and attach it to another of your opponent's Pokémon of your choice.

attacks.name: Telekinesis
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

flavorText: A scientist created this Pokémon after years of horrific gene-splicing and DNA engineering experiments.

name: Moltres

attacks.name: Wildfire
attacks.text: You may discard any number of Fire Energy cards attached to Moltres when you use this attack. If you do, discard that many cards from the top of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Dive Bomb
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: Known as the legendary bird of fire. Every flap of its wings creates a dazzling flash of flames.

name: Nidoking

attacks.name: Thrash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 30 damage and Nidoking does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Toxic
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. It now takes 20 Poison damage instead of 10 after each player's turn (even if it was already Poisoned).

flavorText: Uses its powerful tail in battle to smash, constrict, then break its prey's bones.

name: Nidoqueen

attacks.name: Boyfriends
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 20 more damage for each Nidoking you have in play.

flavorText: Its hard scales provide strong protection. It uses its hefty bulk to execute powerful moves.

name: Pidgeot

attacks.name: Hurricane
attacks.text: Unless this attack Knocks Out the Defending Pokémon, return the Defending Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your opponent's hand.

flavorText: When hunting, it skims the surface of water at high speed to pick off unwary prey such as Magikarp.

name: Pidgeotto

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Mirror Move
attacks.text: If Pidgeotto was attacked last turn, do the final result of that attack on Pidgeotto to the Defending Pokémon.

flavorText: Very protective of its sprawling territory, this Pokémon will fiercely peck at any intruder.

name: Rhydon

attacks.name: Ram
attacks.text: Rhydon does 20 damage to itself. Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon. Switch the Pokémon even if Rhydon is Knocked Out.)

flavorText: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3600 degrees.

name: Arcanine

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Arcanine or this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Arcanine does 30 damage to itself.

flavorText: A Pokémon that has been long admired for its beauty. It runs gracefully, as if on wings.

name: Charmeleon

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Charmeleon or this attack does nothing.

flavorText: When it swings its burning tail, it raises the temperature to unbearably high levels.

name: Dark Dragonair

abilities.name: Evolutionary Light
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for an Evolution card. Show it to your opponent and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Dark Dragonair is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Tail Strike
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 20 damage.

flavorText: As is fitting for a legendary Pokémon, it has many strange powers, including the ability to make rain or snow fall.

name: Dark Wartortle

attacks.name: Doubleslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Mirror Shell
attacks.text: If an attack does damage to Dark Wartortle during your opponent's next turn (even if Dark Wartortle is Knocked Out), Dark Wartortle does an equal amount of damage to the Defending Pokémon.

flavorText: A Pokémon with a negative attitude, it hides in its shell whenever it's in a bad mood—which is often.

name: Dewgong

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: Stores thermal energy in its body. Swims at a steady 8 knots even in intensely cold waters.

name: Dodrio

abilities.name: Retreat Aid
abilities.text: As long as Dodrio is Benched, pay Colorless less to retreat your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Dodrio.

flavorText: Uses its three brains to execute complex plans. While two heads sleep, one head stays awake.

name: Fearow

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Fearow.

flavorText: With its huge and magnificent wings, it can keep aloft without ever having to land for rest.

name: Golduck

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 of them and discard it.

flavorText: Often seen swimming elegantly by lake shores. It is often mistaken for the Japanese monster, Kappa.

name: Graveler

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, whenever 30 or less damage is done to Graveler (after applying Weakness and Resistance), prevent that damage. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

flavorText: Rolls down slopes to move. It rolls over any obstacle without slowing or changing its direction.

name: Growlithe
flavorText: Very protective of its territory. It will bark and bite to repel intruders from its space.

name: Haunter

abilities.name: Transparency
abilities.text: Whenever an attack does anything to Haunter, flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of that attack, including damage, done to Haunter. This power stops working while Haunter is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Nightmare
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

flavorText: Because of its ability to slip through block walls, it is said to be from another dimension.

name: Ivysaur

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: When the bulb on its back grows large, the Pokémon seems to lose the ability to stand on its hind legs.

name: Kabuto

abilities.name: Kabuto Armor
abilities.text: Whenever an attack (even your own) does damage to Kabuto (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack does only half the damage to Kabuto (rounded down to the nearest 10). (Any other effects of attacks still happen.) This power stops working while Kabuto is affected by a Special Condition.

flavorText: A Pokémon that was resurrected from a fossil found in what was once the ocean floor eons ago.

name: Kadabra

attacks.name: Recover
attacks.text: Discard 1 Psychic Energy card attached to Kadabra or this attack does nothing. Remove all damage counters from Kadabra.

flavorText: It emits special alpha waves from its body that induce headaches even to those just nearby.

name: Kakuna

attacks.name: Stiffen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Kakuna during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: Almost incapable of moving, this Pokémon can only harden its shell to protect itself from predators.

name: Machoke

attacks.name: Karate Chop
attacks.text: Does 50 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on Machoke.

attacks.name: Submission
attacks.text: Machoke does 20 damage to itself.

flavorText: Its muscular body is so powerful that it must wear a power-save belt to help regulate its motions.

name: Magikarp

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Magikarp.

flavorText: In the distant past, it was stronger than its horribly weak descendants that exist today.

name: Meowth

attacks.name: Pay Day
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, draw a card.

flavorText: Adores circular objects. Wanders the streets on a nightly basis to look for dropped loose change.

name: Metapod

attacks.name: Stiffen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Metapod during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: It is vulnerable to attack because its shell is soft, exposing its weak and tender body.

name: Nidorina

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: The female's horn develops slowly. Prefers physical attacks such as clawing and biting.

name: Nidorino

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: An aggressive Pokémon that is quick to attack. The horn on its head secretes a powerful venom.

name: Omanyte

abilities.name: Clairvoyance
abilities.text: Your opponent plays with his or her hand face up. This power stops working while Omanyte is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Omanyte but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

flavorText: Although long extinct, in rare cases, it can be genetically resurrected from fossils.

name: Omastar

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Omastar but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Spike Cannon
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: A prehistoric Pokémon that died out when its heavy shell made it impossible for it to catch prey.

name: Primeape

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Tantrum
