attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Primeape is now Confused (after doing damage).

flavorText: Always furious and tenacious to boot. It will not abandon chasing its quarry until its quarry is caught.

name: Rapidash

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 20 damage.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Rapidash.

flavorText: Very competitive, this Pokémon will chase anything that moves fast in the hope of racing it.

name: Raticate

attacks.name: Super Fang
attacks.text: Does damage to the Defending Pokémon equal to half the Defending Pokémon's remaining HP (rounded up to the nearest 10).

flavorText: It uses its whiskers to maintain its balance. It seems to slow down if they are cut off.

name: Sandslash

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: Curls up into a spiny ball when threatened. It can roll while curled up to attack or escape.

name: Seadra

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Seadra but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Seadra.

flavorText: Capable of swimming backward by rapidly flapping its wing-like pectoral fins and stout tail.

name: Snorlax

abilities.name: Thick Skinned
abilities.text: Snorlax can't become Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, Poisoned, or Burned. This power stops working while Snorlax is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: Very lazy. Just eats and sleeps. As its rotund bulk builds, it becomes steadily more slothful.

name: Tauros

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 20 damage.

attacks.name: Rampage
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Tauros. Flip a coin. If tails, Tauros is now Confused (after doing damage).

flavorText: When it targets an enemy, it charges furiously while whipping its body with its long tails.

name: Tentacruel

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Jellyfish Sting
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: The tentacles are normally kept short. On hunts, the are extended to ensnare and immobilize prey.

name: Abra

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: Using its ability to read minds, it will identify impending danger and teleport to safety.

name: Bulbasaur

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Unless all damage from this attack is prevented, you may remove 1 damage counter from Bulbasaur.

flavorText: A strange seed was planted on its back at birth. Thus, a plant sprouted and now grows with this Pokémon.

name: Caterpie

attacks.name: String Shot
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.

name: Charmander

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Charmander or this attack does nothing.

flavorText: Obviously prefers hot places. If it gets caught in the rain, steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.

name: Doduo

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: A bird that makes up for its poor flying with its fast foot speed. Leaves giant footprints.

name: Dratini
flavorText: Long considered a mythical Pokémon until recently, when a small colony was found living underwater.

name: Drowzee

abilities.name: Long-Distance Hypnosis
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep; if tails, your Active Pokémon is now Asleep. The power can't be used if Drowzee is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Nightmare
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

flavorText: Not popular with girls because of its attitude. Can often be heard muttering to itself in a low voice.

name: Eevee

attacks.name: Tail Wag
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack Eevee during your opponent's next turn. (Benching either Pokémon ends this effect.)

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

flavorText: Its genetic code is irregular. It may mutate if it is exposed to radiation from elemental stones.

name: Exeggcute

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Unless all damage from this attack is prevented, you may remove 1 damage counter from Exeggcute.

flavorText: Often mistaken for eggs. When disturbed, they quickly gather and attack in swarms.

name: Gastly

attacks.name: Lick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Energy Conversion
attacks.text: Put up to 2 Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand. Gastly does 10 damage to itself.

flavorText: A mysterious Pokémon. Some say it is a lifeform from another dimension, while others believe it is formed from smog.

name: Geodude

attacks.name: Stone Barrage
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: Found in fields and mountains. Mistaking them for boulders, people often step or trip on them.

name: Grimer

attacks.name: Nasty Goo
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Minimized
attacks.text: All damage done by attacks to Grimer during your opponent's next turn is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: Appears in filthy areas. Thrives by sucking up polluted sludge that is pumped out of factories.

name: Machop
flavorText: It's said that not even pro wrestlers can take down a Machop.

name: Magnemite

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Pokémon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Magnemite does 40 damage to itself.

flavorText: Uses anti-gravity to stay suspended. Appears without warning and uses attacks like Thunder Wave.

name: Mankey

attacks.name: Mischief
attacks.text: Shuffle your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Anger
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 20 damage.

flavorText: Normally friendly, it quickly becomes angry if it doesn't get what it wants.

name: Nidoran ♀

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon named Nidoran ♀ or Nidoran ♂ and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. (You can't use this attack if your Bench is full.)

flavorText: Although small, its venomous barbs make this Pokémon dangerous. The female has smaller horns.

name: Nidoran ♂

attacks.name: Horn Hazard
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: Stiffens its ears to sense danger. The larger, more powerful of its horns secretes venom.

name: Onix

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, whenever 30 or less damage is done to Onix (after applying Weakness and Resistance), prevent that damage. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

flavorText: As it grows, the stone portions of its body harden to become similar to a diamond, though colored black.

name: Pidgey

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

flavorText: A common sight in forests and woods. It flaps its wings at ground level to kick up blinding sand.

name: Pikachu

attacks.name: Spark
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: When several of these Pokémon gather, their electricity can build and cause lightning storms.

name: Ponyta
flavorText: Its hooves are 10 times harder than diamonds. It can trample anything flat in moments.

name: Psyduck

attacks.name: Dizziness
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Psyduck but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

flavorText: It is often seen holding its head in its paws, as if it were suffering from a headache.

name: Rattata
flavorText: Bites anything when it attacks. Small and very quick, it is a common sight in many places.

name: Rhyhorn

attacks.name: Leer
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn. (Benching either Pokémon ends this effect.)

flavorText: Its massive bones are 1,000 times harder than human bones. It can easily knock a trailer flying.

name: Sandshrew

attacks.name: Sand-attack
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

flavorText: Burrow deep underground in arid locations far from water. It only emerges to hunt for food.

name: Seel
flavorText: The protruding horn on its head is very hard. This horn is used for bashing through thick ice.

name: Slowpoke

attacks.name: Spacing Out
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, remove a damage counter from Slowpoke. This attack can't be used if Slowpoke has no damage counters on it.

attacks.name: Scavenge
attacks.text: Discard 1 Psychic Energy card attached to Slowpoke in order to use this attack. Put a Trainer card from your discard pile into your hand.

flavorText: Incredibly slow and dopey. It takes 5 seconds for it to feel pain when under attack.

name: Spearow

attacks.name: Mirror Move
attacks.text: If Spearow was attacked last turn, do the final result of that attack on Spearow to the Defending Pokémon.

flavorText: Eats bugs in grassy areas. It has to flap its short wings at high speed to stay airborne.

name: Squirtle

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Withdraw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Squirtle during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

flavorText: After birth, its back swells and hardens into a shell. It powerfully sprays foam from its mouth.

name: Tentacool

abilities.name: Cowardice
abilities.text: At any time during your turn (before your attack), you may return Tentacool to your hand. (Discard all cards attached to Tentacool.) This power can't be used the turn you put Tentacool into play or if Tentacool is affected by a Special Condition.

flavorText: Drifts in shallow seas. Anglers who hook them by accident are often punished by its stinging acid.

name: Voltorb
flavorText: Usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a Poké Ball, it has zapped many people.

name: Vulpix

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: At the time of birth, it has just one tail. Its tail splits from the tip as it grows older.

name: Weedle

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: Often found in forests, eating leaves. It has a sharp, venomous stinger on its head.

name: Full Heal Energy
rules: If you play this card from your hand, the Pokémon you attach it to is no longer affected by a Special Condition. Full Heal Energy provides Colorless energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

name: Potion Energy
rules: If you play this card from your hand, remove 1 damage counter from the Pokémon you attach it to, if it has any. Potion Energy provides Colorless energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

name: Pokémon Breeder
rules: Put a Stage 2 Evolution card from your hand on the matching Basic Pokémon. You can play this card only when you would be allowed to evolve that Pokémon anyway.

name: Pokémon Trader
rules: Trade 1 of the Basic Pokémon or Evolution cards in your hand for 1 of the Basic Pokémon or Evolution cards from your deck. Show both cards to your opponent. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Scoop Up
rules: Choose 1 of your Pokémon in play and return its Basic Pokémon card to your hand. (Discard all cards attached to that card.)

name: The Boss's Way
rules: Search your deck for an Evolution card with Dark in its name. Show it to your opponent and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Challenge!
rules: Ask your opponent if he or she accepts your challenge. If your opponent declines (or if both Benches are full), draw 2 cards. If your opponent accepts, each of you searches your decks for any number of Basic Pokémon cards and puts them face down onto your Benches. (A player can't do this if his or her Bench is full.) When you both have finished, shuffle your decks and turn those cards face up.

name: Energy Retrieval
rules: Trade 1 of the other cards in your hand for up to 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile.

name: Bill
rules: Draw 2 cards.

name: Mysterious Fossil
rules: Play Mysterious Fossil as if it were a Basic Pokémon. While in play, Mysterious Fossil counts as a Pokémon (instead of a Trainer card). Mysterious Fossil has no attacks, can't retreat, and can't be affected by Special Conditions. If Mysterious Fossil is Knocked Out, it doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon. (Discard it anyway.) At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Mysterious Fossil from play. You can put Pokémon that evolve from Mysterious Fossil on this card.

name: Potion
rules: Remove up to 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon.

name: Pikachu

attacks.name: Growl
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon attacks Pikachu during your opponent's next turn, any damage done by the attack is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). (Benching either Pokémon ends this effect.)

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: When several of these Pokémon gather, their electricity could build and cause lightning storms.

name: Electabuzz

attacks.name: Light Screen
attacks.text: Whenever an attack does damage to Electabuzz (after applying Weakness and Resistance) during your opponent's next turn, that attack only does half the damage to Electabuzz (rounded down to the nearest 10). (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

flavorText: A wild Pokémon with a short temper. It is able to distinguish colors, and likes the color red.

name: Mewtwo

attacks.name: Energy Absorption
attacks.text: Choose up to 2 Energy cards from your discard pile and attach them to Mewtwo.

flavorText: Years of genetic experiments resulted in the creation of this never-before-seen violent Pokémon.

name: Pikachu

attacks.name: Recharge
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to Pikachu. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy cards attached to Pikachu in order to use this attack.

flavorText: When several of these Pokémon gather, they attract so much electricity that they can cause lightning to strike.

name: Dragonite

abilities.name: Special Delivery
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw a card. If you do, choose a card from your hand and put it on top of your deck. This power can't be used if Dragonite is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Supersonic Flight
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: This Pokémon can fly is spite of its large bulk. It is said to be able to circumnavigate the earth in just 16 hours.

name: Arcanine

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Flames of Rage
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy cards attached to Arcanine in order to use this attack. This attack does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Arcanine.

flavorText: A legendary Pokémon famous for its beauty. It looks almost as if it flies when it runs.

name: Jigglypuff

attacks.name: First Aid
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from Jigglypuff.

attacks.name: Double-edge
attacks.text: Jigglypuff does 20 damage to itself.

flavorText: When its huge eyes light up, it sings a mysteriously soothing melody that lulls its enemies to sleep.

name: Mew

attacks.name: Psywave
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of Energy cards attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Devolution Beam
attacks.text: Choose an evolved Pokémon (your own or your opponent's). Return the highest Stage Evolution card on that Pokémon to its player's hand. That Pokémon is no longer Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned, or anything else that might be the result of an attack (just as if you had evolved it).

flavorText: So rare that it is still said to be a mirage by many experts. Only a few people have seen it worldwide.

name: Mew

attacks.name: Psywave
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of Energy cards attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Devolution Beam
attacks.text: Choose an evolved Pokémon (your own or your opponent's). Return the highest Stage Evolution card on that Pokémon to its player's hand. That Pokémon is no longer Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned, or anything else that might be the result of an attack (just as if you had evolved it).

flavorText: So rare that it is still said to be a mirage by many experts. Only a few people have seen it worldwide.

name: Meowth

attacks.name: Cat Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage. If tails and if your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and this attack does 20 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: Adores circular objects. Wanders the streets on a nightly basis to look for dropped loose change.

name: Eevee

abilities.name: Chain Reaction
abilities.text: This power can only be used when a Pokémon evolves. Search your deck for a card that evolves from Eevee and attach it to Eevee. This counts as evolving Eevee. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Eevee is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

flavorText: Its genetic code is irregular. It may mutate if it is exposed to radiation from elemental stones.

name: Mewtwo

attacks.name: Energy Control
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a basic Energy card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and attach it to another of your opponent's Pokémon of your choice.

attacks.name: Telekinesis
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

flavorText: A scientist created this Pokémon after years of horrific gene-splicing and DNA engineering experiments.

name: Venusaur

abilities.name: Solar Power
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this power. Your Active Pokémon and the Defending Pokémon are no longer Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned. This power can't be used if Venusaur is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Mega Drain
attacks.text: Remove a number of damage counters from Venusaur equal to half the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance) (rounded up to the nearest 10). If Venusaur has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

flavorText: This plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.

name: Mewtwo

attacks.name: Energy Absorption
attacks.text: Choose up to 2 Energy cards from your discard pile and attach them to Mewtwo.

flavorText: Years of genetic experiments resulted in the creation of this never-before-seen violent Pokémon.

name: Cool Porygon

attacks.name: Texture Magic
attacks.text: You may change Cool Porygon's Resistance to a type of your choice other than Colorless. If the Defending Pokémon has a Weakness, you may change it to a type of your choice other than Colorless. (Benching either Pokémon ends the effect on that Pokémon.)

attacks.name: 3-D Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: A Pokémon that consists entirely of programming code. Capable of moving freely in cyberspace.

name: Computer Error
rules: You may draw up to 5 cards, then your opponent may draw up to 5 cards. Your turn is over now (you don't get to attack).

name: Dark Persian

attacks.name: Tempt
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Poison Claws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. if heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: Popular with women because of its beautiful fur. The leader of the Rockets keeps one as a pet.

name: Team Rocket's Meowth

attacks.name: Miraculous Comeback
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Pokémon in play. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads. Then Team Rocket's Meowth does 10 damage times the number of tails to itself.

flavorText: This Pokémon is more active at night. It likes bright, shiny things and cannot resist taking them and adding them to its collection.

attacks.name: Synchronize
attacks.text: This attack can't be used unless Sabrina's Abra and the Defending Pokémon have the same number of Energy cards attached to them.

name: Psyduck

attacks.name: Headache
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play Trainer cards during his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: While lulling its enemies with its vacant look, this wily Pokémon will use psychokinetic powers.

name: Moltres

attacks.name: Hyper Flame
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Moltres. If tails, discard all Energy cards attached to Moltres. If you can't discard Energy cards, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: The flames on this legendary Pokémon's wings burn so brightly that they can make night seem like day.

name: Articuno

attacks.name: Diamond Dust
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: This legendary Pokémon is said to freeze the water in the air during winter, causing snow.

name: Zapdos

attacks.name: Lightning Burn
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, and if your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) If tails, Zapdos does 30 damage to itself.

flavorText: This legendary Pokémon is said to be present wherever there is a lightning storm.

attacks.name: Birthday Surprise
attacks.text: If it's not your birthday, this attack does 30 damage. If it is your birthday, flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 50 more damage; if tails, this attack does 30 damage.

name: Flying Pikachu

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Fly
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Flying Pikachu; if tails, this attack does nothing (not even damage).

flavorText: By learning how to fly, Pikachu overcame its weakness to Fighting Pokémon.

name: Pikachu

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy cards attached to Pikachu.

flavorText: It uses its sensitive tail to sense its environment and has been known to react violently if its tail is grabbed.

name: Pikachu

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Pikachu.

flavorText: When several of these Pokémon gather, their electricity can cause lightning storms.

name: Surfing Pikachu
flavorText: One summer, a group of Pikachus was found riding the waves at the local beach.

name: Marill

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Marill but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

flavorText: The tip of its tail, which contains oil that is lighter than water, lets it swim without drowning.

name: Togepi

attacks.name: Snivel
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon attacks Togepi during your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Togepi is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance). (Benching either Pokémon ends this effect.)

attacks.name: Mini-Metronome
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. Mini-Metronome copies that attack except for its Energy cost. (You must still do anything else in order to use that attack.) (No matter what type the Defending Pokémon is, Togepi's type is still Colorless.) Togepi performs that attack.

flavorText: Still only a hatchling, it uses poison to chase off its enemies when threatened.

name: Cleffa
rules: If this Baby Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and your opponent announces an attack, your opponent flips a coin (before doing anything else). If tails, your opponent's turn ends.

attacks.name: Eek
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

flavorText: Because of its unusual, star-like silhouette, people believe that it came here on a meteor.

name: Smeargle

attacks.name: Paint
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a type (other than Colorless) and put a Coloring counter on the Defending Pokémon. That Pokémon is now the type you chose. If it already had a Coloring counter, remove the old one. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: Once it becomes an adult, it has a tendency to let its comrades plant footprints on its back.

name: Scizor

attacks.name: Leer
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack Scizor during your opponent's next turn. (Benching either Pokémon ends this effect.)

attacks.name: Metal Pincer
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads.

flavorText: Its wings are not used for flying. They are flapped at high speed to adjust its body temperature.

name: Entei

abilities.name: Bolt
abilities.text: Whenever your opponent's attack damages Entei, unless that attack Knocks Out Entei, flip a coin. If heads, shuffle Entei and all cards attached to it into your deck. This power can't be used if Entei is already Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed when it is damaged.

attacks.name: Protective Flame
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to your Benched Pokémon.

flavorText: Volcanoes erupt when it barks. Unable to restrain its extreme power, it races headlong around the land.

name: Pichu
rules: If this Baby Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and your opponent announces an attack, your opponent flips a coin (before doing anything else). If tails, your opponent's turn ends.

attacks.name: Let's Play!
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Baby Pokémon card and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. (You can't use this attack if your Bench is full.)

flavorText: It is not yet skilled at storing electricity. It may send out a jolt if amused or startled.

name: Igglybuff
rules: If this Baby Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and your opponent announces an attack, your opponent flips a coin (before doing anything else). If tails, your opponent's turn ends.

attacks.name: Good Night Song
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

flavorText: Its extremely flexible and elastic body makes it bounce continuously—anytime, anywhere.

name: Hitmontop

attacks.name: Repeating Kick
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Rapid Spin
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with his or her Active Pokémon, then, if you have any Benched Pokémon, you switch 1 of them with your Active Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

flavorText: It launches kicks while spinning. If it spins at high speed, it may bore its way into the ground.

name: Unown [J]
rules: You may have up to 4 Basic Pokémon cards in your deck with Unown in their names.

abilities.name: [Join]
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have Unown [J], Unown [O], Unown [I], and Unown Dragon on your Bench, you may search your deck for a Basic Pokémon or Evolution card. Show that card to your opponent, then put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

flavorText: Their shapes look like hieroglyphs on ancient tablets. It is said that the two are somehow related.

name: Misdreavus

attacks.name: Pain Split
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on the Defending Pokémon for each damage counter on Misdreavus.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: It loves to bite and yank people's hair from behind without warning, just to see their shocked reactions.

name: Pokémon Center
rules: Remove all damage counters from all of your own Pokémon with damage counters on them, then discard all Energy cards attached to those Pokémon.

name: Lucky Stadium
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.
Once during each player's turn (before attacking), that player may flip a coin. If heads, that player draws a card.

name: Pokémon Tower
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.
If the effect of a Pokémon Power, attack, Energy card, or Trainer card would put a card in a discard pile into its owner's hand, that card stays in that discard pile instead.

name: Machamp

attacks.name: Seething Anger
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of damage counters on Machamp. This attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Fling
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

flavorText: Using its amazing muscles, it throws powerful punches that can knock its victim clear over the horizon.

name: Magmar

attacks.name: Burning Fire
attacks.text: When you use this attack, you may discard any number of Fire Energy cards attached to your Pokémon in play. This attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Fire Energy card you discarded in this way.

flavorText: Its body always burns with an orange glow that enables it to hide perfectly among flames.

name: Scyther

attacks.name: Slashing Strike
attacks.text: Scyther can't use this attack during your next turn. (Benching or evolving Scyther ends this effect.)

flavorText: With ninja-like agility and speed, it can create the illusion that there is more than one.

name: Electabuzz

attacks.name: Lightning Rod
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and put a Lightning Rod marker on it. (A Pokémon can have only 1 Lightning Rod marker on it at a time.)

attacks.name: Lightning Bolt
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to any Pokémon with a Lightning Rod marker on it. Apply Weakness and Resistance.

flavorText: Normally found near power plants, it can wander away and cause major blackouts in cities.

name: Mew

abilities.name: Neutral Shield
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Mew by Evolved Pokémon. You can't use this power if Mew is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: So rare that it is still said to be a mirage by many experts. Only a few people have seen it worldwide.

name: Articuno

abilities.name: Aurora Veil
abilities.text: As long as Articuno is your Active Pokémon, your Benched Pokémon do not take damage from and are not affected by attacks. This power cannot be used if Articuno is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: A legendary bird Pokémon that is said to appear to doomed people who are lost in icy mountains.

name: Snorlax

abilities.name: Guard
abilities.text: As long as Snorlax is your Active Pokémon, the Defending Pokémon can't Retreat. This power stops working when Snorlax is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Roll Over
attacks.text: Snorlax is now Asleep. Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

flavorText: Very lazy. Just eats and sleeps. As its rotund bulk builds, it becomes steadily more slothful.

attacks.name: Leaf Slice
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Jump Over
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them. Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Super Singe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Sacred Wing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack's base damage is 20 instead of 60.

abilities.name: Pure Body
abilities.text: To attach a Water Energy card from your hand to Suicune, you must discard an Energy card attached to Suicune. (Attach the Water Energy, and then discard an Energy card from Suicune.)

attacks.name: Hypno Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage. If tails, this attack does 30 damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Electabuzz

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Thunderpunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 30 damage plus Electabuzz does 10 damage to itself.

flavorText: Normally found near power plants, it can wander away and cause major blackouts in cities.

name: Hitmonchan
flavorText: While seeming to do nothing, it fires punches in lightning-fast volleys that are impossible to see.

name: Professor Elm
rules: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 7 cards. You can't play any more Trainer cards this turn.

attacks.name: Focus
attacks.text: During your next turn, Rocket's Scizor's Agility attack's damage is doubled.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Rocket's Scizor.

attacks.name: Entrap
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Continuous Scratch
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

abilities.name: Vine Pull
abilities.text: Once during your turn when Dark Ivysaur retreats, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with his or her Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fury Strikes
attacks.text: Your opponent puts 3 markers onto his or her Pokémon (divided as he or she chooses). (More than 1 marker can be put on the same Pokémon.) Then, this attack does 10 damage to each Pokémon for each marker on it. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance. Remove the markers at the end of the turn.

attacks.name: Horrid Pollen
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If 1 is heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned. If both are heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned. If both are tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Juxtapose
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, switch the number of damage counters on Rocket's Mewtwo with the number of damage counters on the Defending Pokémon (even if it would Knock Out either Pokémon). (It's okay if 1 of the Pokémon has no damage counters on it.)

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Crosscounter
attacks.text: If an attack does damage to Rocket's Hitmonchan during your opponent's next turn (even if Rocket's Hitmonchan is Knocked Out), flip a coin. If heads, Rocket's Hitmonchan attacks your opponent's Active Pokémon for double that amount of damage. (If Rocket's Hitmonchan takes 20 damage, it does 40 damage to that Pokémon.)

name: Snivy
flavorText: They photosynthesize by bathing their tails in sunlight. When they are not feeling well, their tails droop.

name: Snivy

attacks.name: Leaf Blade
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

flavorText: They photosynthesize by bathing their tails in sunlight. When they are not feeling well, their tails droop.

name: Servine

attacks.name: Wrap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: They avoid attacks by sinking into the shadows of thick foliage. They retaliate with masterful whipping techniques.

name: Servine

attacks.name: Wring Out
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

flavorText: They avoid attacks by sinking into the shadows of thick foliage. They retaliate with masterful whipping techniques.

name: Serperior

attacks.name: Leaf Storm
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from each of your Grass Pokémon.

flavorText: They raise their heads to intimidate opponents but only give it their all when fighting a powerful opponent.

name: Serperior

abilities.name: Royal Heal
abilities.text: At any time between turns, heal 10 damage from each of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Leaf Tornado
attacks.text: Move as many Grass Energy attached to your Pokémon to your other Pokémon in any way you like.

flavorText: They raise their heads to intimidate opponents but only give it their all when fighting a powerful opponent.

name: Pansage
flavorText: It shares the leaf on its head with weary-looking Pokémon. These leaves are known to relieve stress.

name: Simisage

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: It attacks enemies with strikes of its thorn-covered tail. This Pokémon is wild tempered.

name: Petilil

attacks.name: Magical Leaf
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage and heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

flavorText: Since they prefer moist, nutrient-rich soil, the areas where Petilil live are known to be good for growing plants.

name: Lilligant

attacks.name: Petal Dance
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads. This Pokémon is now confused.

attacks.name: Leaf Storm
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from each of your Grass Pokémon.

flavorText: The fragrance of the garland on its head has a relaxing effect. It withers if a Trainer does not take good care of it.

name: Maractus

attacks.name: Mega Drain
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Pin Missile
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: It uses an up-tempo song and dance to drive away the bird Pokémon that prey on its flower seeds.

name: Maractus

attacks.name: Constant Rattle
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. If 1 of them is heads, this attack does 10 damage. If 2 of them are heads, this attack does 30 damage. If all of them are heads, this attack does 60 damage.

attacks.name: Giga Drain
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to the Defending Pokémon.

flavorText: Arid regions are their habitat. They move rhythmically, making a sound similar to maracas.

name: Deerling

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

flavorText: The color and scent of their fur changes to match the mountain grass. When they sense hostility, they hide in the grass.

name: Sawsbuck

attacks.name: Nature Power
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each Grass Energy attached to both your and your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Horn Leech
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

flavorText: They migrate according to the seasons. People can tell the season by looking at Sawsbuck's horns.

name: Tepig
flavorText: It can deftly dodge its foe's attacks while shooting fireballs from its nose. It roasts berries before it eats them.

name: Tepig

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

flavorText: It can deftly dodge its foe's attacks while shooting fireballs from its nose. It roasts berries before it eats them.

name: Pignite

attacks.name: Flame Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fire Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

flavorText: When its internal fire flares up, its movements grow sharper and faster. When in trouble, it emits smoke.

name: Pignite

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

flavorText: When its internal fire flares up, its movements grow sharper and faster. When in trouble, it emits smoke.

name: Emboar

attacks.name: Flare Blitz
attacks.text: Discard all Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

flavorText: It can throw a fire punch by setting its fists on fire with its fiery chin. It cares deeply about its friends.

name: Emboar

abilities.name: Inferno Fandango
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Fire Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

flavorText: It can throw a fire punch by setting its fists on fire with its fiery chin. It cares deeply about its friends.

name: Pansear
flavorText: When it is angered, the temperature of its head tuft reaches 600° F. It uses its tuft to roast berries.

name: Simisear

attacks.name: Flame Burst
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: It loves sweets because they become energy for the fire burning inside its body.

name: Darumaka

attacks.name: Firebreathing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

flavorText: Darumaka's droppings are hot, so people used to put them in their clothes to keep themselves warm.

name: Darumaka

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

flavorText: Darumaka's droppings are hot, so people used to put them in their clothes to keep themselves warm.

name: Darmanitan

attacks.name: Fire Fang
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Thrash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage. If tails, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

flavorText: When weakened in battle, it transforms into a stone statue, then it sharpens its mind and fights on mentally.

name: Reshiram

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Blue Flare
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

flavorText: This Pokémon appears in legends. It sends flames into the air from its tail, burning up everything around it.

name: Oshawott
flavorText: The scalchop on its stomach is made from the same elements as claws. It detaches the scalchop for use as a blade.

name: Oshawott

attacks.name: Razor Shell
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

flavorText: The scalchop on its stomach is made from the same elements as claws. It detaches the scalchop for use as a blade.

name: Dewott

attacks.name: Razor Shell
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

flavorText: Scalchop techniques differ from one Dewott to another. It never neglects maintaining its scalchops.

name: Dewott

attacks.name: Aqua Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 10 more damage for each heads.

flavorText: Scalchop techniques differ from one Dewott to another. It never neglects maintaining its scalchops.

name: Samurott

attacks.name: Pike
attacks.text: Does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: Part of the armor on its anterior legs becomes a giant sword. Its cry alone is enough to intimidate most enemies.

name: Samurott

abilities.name: Shell Armor
abilities.text: Any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

flavorText: Part of the armor on its anterior legs becomes a giant sword. Its cry alone is enough to intimidate most enemies.

name: Panpour
flavorText: It does not thrive in dry environments. It keeps itself damp by shooting water stored in its head tuft from its tail.

name: Simipour

attacks.name: Scald
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: The high-pressure water expelled from its tail is so powerful, it can destroy a concrete wall.

name: Basculin

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

flavorText: Red and blue Basculin get along so poorly, they'll start fighting instantly. These Pokémon are very hostile.

name: Ducklett
flavorText: These bird Pokémon are excellent divers. They swim around in the water eating their favorite food—peat moss.

name: Swanna

attacks.name: Feather Dance
attacks.text: During your next turn, each of this Pokémon's attacks does 40 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Aqua Ring
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

flavorText: Swanna start to dance at dusk. The one dancing in the middle is the leader of the flock.

name: Alomomola
flavorText: Floating in the open sea is how they live. When they find a wounded Pokémon, they embrace it and bring it to shore.

name: Alomomola

attacks.name: Water Pulse
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

flavorText: Floating in the open sea is how they live. When they find a wounded Pokémon, they embrace it and bring it to shore.

name: Blitzle
flavorText: When thunderclouds cover the sky, it will appear. It can catch lightning with its mane and store the electricity.

name: Blitzle

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

flavorText: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use their flashing manes to communicate with one another.

name: Zebstrika

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Wild Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

flavorText: This ill-tempered Pokémon is dangerous because when it's angry, it shoots lightning from its mane in all directions.

name: Zebstrika

attacks.name: Electrispark
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.

name: Joltik

attacks.name: Stun Needle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: They attach themselves to large-bodied Pokémon and absorb static electricity, which they store in an electric pouch.

name: Joltik

attacks.name: Leech Life
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to the Defending Pokémon.

flavorText: They attach themselves to large-bodied Pokémon and absorb static electricity, which they store in an electric pouch.

name: Galvantula

attacks.name: Electroweb
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Leech Life
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to the Defending Pokémon.

flavorText: They employ an electrically charged web to trap their prey. While it is immobilized by shock, they leisurely consume it.

name: Zekrom

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Bolt Strike
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 40 damage to itself.

flavorText: This Pokémon appears in legends. In its tail, it has a giant generator that creates electricity.

name: Munna

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Dream Eater
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is not Asleep, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: Munna always float in the air. People whose dreams are eaten by them forget what the dreams had been about.

name: Musharna

attacks.name: Hypnotic Ray
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Dream Eater
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is not Asleep, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: The mist emanating from their foreheads is packed with the dreams of people and Pokémon.

name: Woobat
flavorText: Its habitat is dark forests and caves. It emits ultrasonic waves from its nose to learn about its surroundings.

name: Swoobat

attacks.name: Attract
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

flavorText: It emits sound waves of various frequencies from its nose, including some powerful enough to destroy rocks.

name: Venipede
flavorText: Its bite injects a potent poison, enough to paralyze large bird Pokémon that try to prey on it.

name: Whirlipede

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: Protected by a hard shell, it spins its body like a wheel and crashes furiously into its enemies.

name: Scolipede

attacks.name: Steamroller
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Poison Claws
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: Highly aggressive, it uses the claws near its neck to dig into its opponent and poison them.

name: Solosis

attacks.name: Cell Culture
attacks.text: Search your deck for Solosis and put it into your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

flavorText: Because their bodies are enveloped in a special liquid, they can survive in any environment.

name: Duosion

attacks.name: Recover
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon and heal all damage from this Pokémon.

flavorText: When their brains, now divided in two, are thinking the same thought, these Pokémon exhibit their maximum power.

name: Reuniclus

abilities.name: Damage Swap
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psywave
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

flavorText: These remarkably intelligent Pokémon fight by controlling arms that can grip with rock-crushing power.

name: Timburr
flavorText: It fights by swinging a piece of timber around. It is close to evolving when it can handle the lumber without difficulty.

name: Timburr
flavorText: These Pokémon appear at building sites and help out with construction. They always carry squared logs.

name: Gurdurr

attacks.name: Bulk Up
attacks.text: During your next turn, each of this Pokémon's attacks does 20 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: They strengthen their bodies by carrying steel beams. They show off their big muscles to their friends.

name: Throh

attacks.name: Circle Throw
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Storm Throw
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

flavorText: When they encounter foes bigger than themselves, they try to throw them. They always travel in packs of five.

name: Sawk
flavorText: The sound of Sawk punching boulders and trees can be heard all the way from the mountains where they train.

name: Sandile

attacks.name: Sand Tomb
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

flavorText: It moves along below the sand's surface, except for its nose and eyes. A dark membrane shields its eyes from the sun.

name: Krokorok

attacks.name: Torment
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

flavorText: The special membrane covering its eyes can sense the heat of objects, so it can see its surroundings even in darkness.

name: Krookodile

attacks.name: Torment
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Krookoroll
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 40 more damage.

flavorText: It can expand the focus of its eyes, enabling it to see objects in the far distance as if it were using binoculars.

name: Purrloin
flavorText: Its cute act is a ruse. When victims let down their guard, they find their items taken. It attacks with sharp claws.

name: Liepard

attacks.name: Taunt
attacks.text: Switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sucker Punch
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Darkness Energy attached to it, this attack does 30 more damage.

flavorText: Stealthily, it sneaks up on its target, striking from behind before its victim has a chance to react.

name: Scraggy
flavorText: Its skin has a rubbery elasticity, so it can reduce damage by defensively pulling its skin up to its neck.

name: Scrafty

attacks.name: Spit Acid
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned. Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is also Paralyzed.

flavorText: Groups of them beat up anything that enters their territory. Each can spit acidic liquid from its mouth.

name: Zorua

attacks.name: Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: To protect themselves from danger, they hide their true identities by transforming into people and Pokémon.

name: Zoroark

attacks.name: Nasty Plot
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Foul Play
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks and use it as this attack.

flavorText: Each has the ability to fool a large group of people simultaneously. They protect their lair with illusory scenery.

name: Vullaby

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: Its wings are too tiny to allow it to fly. As the time approaches for it to evolve, it discards the bones it was wearing.

name: Mandibuzz

attacks.name: Blindside
attacks.text: Does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Punishment
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Stage 2 Pokémon, this attack does 60 more damage.

flavorText: It makes a nest out of bones it finds. It grabs weakened prey in its talons and hauls it to its nest of bones.

name: Klink

attacks.name: Bind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: The two minigears that mesh together are predetermined. Each will rebound from other minigears without meshing.

name: Klang

attacks.name: Bind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Gear Grind
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 60 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: By changing the direction in which it rotates, it communicates its feelings to others. When angry, it rotates faster.

name: Klinklang

abilities.name: Shift Gear
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a Metal Energy attached to 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Gear Grind
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 80 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: Its red core functions as an energy tank. It fires the charged energy through its spikes into an area.

name: Patrat
flavorText: Using food stored in cheek pouches, they can keep watches for days. They use their tails to communicate with others.

name: Patrat

attacks.name: Hyper Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: Extremely cautious, they take shifts to maintain a constant watch of their nest. They feel insecure without a lookout.

name: Watchog

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Hyper Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: They make the patterns on their bodies shine in order to threaten predators. Keen eyesight lets them see in the dark.

name: Lillipup

attacks.name: Pickup
attacks.text: Put an Item card from your discard pile into your hand.

flavorText: It faces strong opponents with great courage. But, when at a disadvantage in a fight, this intelligent Pokémon flees.

name: Lillipup

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

flavorText: The long hair around its face provides an amazing radar that lets it sense subtle changes in its surroundings.

name: Herdier

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

flavorText: It loyally follows its Trainer's orders. For ages, they have helped Trainers raise Pokémon.

name: Stoutland

attacks.name: Odor Sleuth
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, put a card from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Giga Impact
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

flavorText: This extremely wise Pokémon excels at rescuing people stranded at sea or in the mountains.

name: Pidove

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

flavorText: Each follows its Trainer's orders as best it can, but they sometimes fail to understand complicated commands.

name: Tranquill

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

flavorText: It can return to its Trainer's location regardless of the distance separating them.

name: Unfezant

attacks.name: Fly
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

flavorText: Males swing their head plumage to threaten opponents. The females' flying abilities surpass those of the males.

name: Audino

attacks.name: Doubleslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: It touches others with the feelers on its ears, using the sound of their heartbeats to tell how they are feeling.

name: Minccino

attacks.name: Tail Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: They greet one another by rubbing each other with their tails, which are always kept well groomed and clean.

name: Cinccino

attacks.name: Tail Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Do the Wave
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the number of your Benched Pokémon.

flavorText: Their white fur is coated in a special oil that makes it easy for them to deflect attacks.

name: Bouffalant

attacks.name: Double Stomp
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

flavorText: They charge wildly and headbutt everything. Their headbutts have enough destructive force to derail a train.

name: Bouffalant

attacks.name: Revenge
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during his or her last turn, this attack does 70 more damage.

attacks.name: Head Charge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

flavorText: Their fluffy fur absorbs damage, even if they strike foes with a fierce headbutt.

name: Energy Retrieval
rules: Put 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Energy Search
rules: Search your deck for a basic Energy card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Energy Switch
rules: Move a basic Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Full Heal
rules: Remove all Special Conditions from your Active Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: PlusPower
rules: During this turn, your Pokémon's attacks do 10 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Poké Ball
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Pokédex
rules: Look at the top 5 cards of your deck and put them back on top of your deck in any order.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Pokémon Communication
rules: Reveal a Pokémon in your hand and put it on top of your deck. If you do, search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Potion
rules: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Professor Juniper
rules: Discard your hand and draw 7 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Revive
rules: Put a Basic Pokémon from your discard pile onto your Bench.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Super Scoop Up
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, put 1 of your Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your hand.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Switch
rules: Switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Reshiram

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: Does 10 more for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Blue Flare
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

flavorText: This Pokémon appears in legends. It sends flames into the air from its tail, burning up everything around it.

name: Zekrom

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Bolt Strike
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 40 damage to itself.

flavorText: This Pokémon appears in legends. In its tail, it has a giant generator that creates electricity.

name: Pikachu

attacks.name: Energize
attacks.text: Attach a Lightning Energy from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy attached to this Pokémon.

flavorText: This is an extremely rare Pikachu card. You're very lucky to have found it!
